channel.title: Hughes on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Hughes on My New Hugo Site

item.title: We Were Promised Skynet
item.description: [whitebox] [big]Today in Tedium: As the recent vote in Congress over online privacy rules reminded us, people tend to hate their internet service providers. Case in point: Offbeat rocker Todd Rundgren once wrote and performed a poorly-aged song called “I Hate My Frickin’ ISP,” in which he railed against the anonymous loser that was preventing him from getting online, along with the service that promised him 20 free, addiction-starting hours.
